text: The 1932 Freeport hurricane was a severe tropical cyclone. The storm happened in August 1932. It mostly affected certain areas of the Upper Texas coast. It was the second storm and first hurricane of the season. It developed near the Mexican Yucat√°n Peninsula on August 12. As it moved to the northwest, it began to get stronger the next day. It quickly went from a Category 1 hurricane to a Category 4. Winds got as high as 150 mph (240 km/h). The storm struck near Freeport, Texas as a Category 4 with maximum sustained winds of 150 mph. The storm caused heavy rainfall inland. Rainfall peaked at 9.93 inches near Angleton. There were 40 deaths from the hurricane. ==References== Category:Hurricanes in the United States Category:20th century in Texas Category:1932 in the United States Category:August events
title: 1932 Freeport hurricane
